quest.name: The Wheel Turns
journal: Thancred wishes to have a word with the hero of the hour.
objectives: Speak with Alisaie in the Crystarium.
Speak with the manager of suites in the Pendants.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It was pure luck that we managed to hold the Eulmorans at bay long enough for you to succeed─but we have earned some good fortune. And while it is plain we've not seen the last of General Ran'jit, I for one am glad to delay our reckoning with him awhile longer.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It seems I was wrong about your friend. Had Feo Ul not stepped in, you'd be frolicking with the faeries by now.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm going to train harder. Having seen what you've achieved, it's the least I can do.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though the battle is over, the war is far from won. Let us fix our gaze upon the road ahead.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I knew you could do it. And not only because of your blessing. You have a strength all your own, and it has seen us through many a trial.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: With the Warden defeated, I believe our work here is done. It is time we were going─together, needless to say.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...To the bitter end─the fate of our two worlds being at stake, and all that.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Now then, I suggest we hurry back to the Crystarium. Much and more may have happened while we were frolicking with the fae folk.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That Ran'jit elected to pursue us makes me hopeful the city was spared Eulmore's attentions, but I would sooner see for myself.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Besides, I believe I speak for us all when I say that I've had a bellyful of Il Mheg. Let us away before the faeries think to play with us again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see nothing out of the ordinary.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Though we've spent most of our time on the road, Minfilia and I actually have apartments here. Perhaps now we may finally make use of them.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: All seems well, thank goodness...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The city appeareth unchanged from when last I visited. There is the selfsame comforting hum of activity in the air.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Forename? I...I was not expecting you so soon.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Glad though I am to see you, I daresay you are missed by your comrades. Mayhap you should rejoin them first.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Finding common ground with an Ascian... My entire being rebels at the very notion.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: He appears to be gone, but I won't be lowering my guard just yet.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: So that was an Ascian... Thancred told me about them.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: That an Ascian of Emet-Selch's standing should willingly reveal himself unto us─and at this of all junctures─is...most interesting.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Cooperation? He can't be serious...can he?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, we've certainly been given much to ponder, but first things first: we should report to the Exarch.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You can run along, Forename. We're perfectly capable of handling this little task.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In light of your recent exertions, I'd say you've earned a rest.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Go on, take yourself off to bed. We'll see you later, refreshed and ready for more.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: That your safe and triumphant return should be spoiled by an uninvited guest...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: But let us not dwell on it here and now. I will have the details of your mission from the others. You, meanwhile, should get some rest.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Ah, welcome back, misssir. We've been expecting you.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: You will find refreshments laid out in your quarters. We hope they are to your liking.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Will you be retiring now?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Retire to your quarters?

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Very good, misssir. I bid you a pleasant evening.
